Description: beads made of different materials A: Poppy seed pendant made of a slightly transparent carnelian, the top end is slightly chipped off and the section of the body is rather oval than round. B: two fragments of cylindrical segmented beads made of white eroded faience. One of them is only half preserved, the other one shows three segments. C: two spherical beads made of faience, one of them white, the other light green. D: one small extended sphere bead made of blue faience. E: three disc-shaped beads made of light green to turquoise faience. F: one disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
